Package classes

Class Date

java.lang.Object
classes.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
Class that declares the classes.Date Event component. Declares a classes.Date by taking in a String. The String gets split into year, month, and day.
Author:
Abhishek Thakare, Adhit Thakur

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Determine if the classes.Date is a valid Calendar date. Only checking if the numbers given exist in Calendar.
      Returns:
      true if the classes.Date is a valid calendar date, false otherwise.

    • hasThirtyOneDays

      private boolean hasThirtyOneDays(int month)
      Determine if the classes.Date's month is supposed to have 31 days. classes.Checking this to ensure that the number entered for the month is valid.
      Parameters:
      month - the classes.Date's month.
      Returns:
      true if the classes.Date's month has 31 days, false otherwise.

    • isLeap

      private boolean isLeap(int year)
      Determine if the classes.Date's year is within a leap year. Used in isValid() to check when February is entered. Makes sure February 29th is not entered in a non-leap year.
      Parameters:
      year - the classes.Date's year.
      Returns:
      true if the classes.Date's year is leap, false otherwise.

    • isValidMonth

      private boolean isValidMonth(int month)
      Determine if the classes.Date's month is a valid number Month. Making sure that a month less than 1 or greater than 12 is entered.
      Parameters:
      month - the classes.Date's month.
      Returns:
      true if month is a valid number month, false otherwise.

    • checkIfWithinBounds

      public boolean checkIfWithinBounds(int month, int year, int day)
      Determine if the given date is today or in the future.
      Parameters:
      month - the classes.Date's month.
      year - the classes.Date's year.
      day - the classes.Date's day.
      Returns:
      1 if the current date is later than the given date, -1 if otherwise, and 0 if they are the same.

    • checkIfInPast

      public int checkIfInPast(int month, int year, int day)
      Determine if the given date is in the past. classes.Date cannot be in the past, as it would have already happened.
      Parameters:
      month - the classes.Date's month.
      year - the classes.Date's year.
      day - the classes.Date's day.
      Returns:
      1 if given date is in the past, -1/0 otherwise.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Determine if two Dates are equal. Compare the days and months and years. If any one these values is not equal, the function is false.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - a Given object that will be compared to the "this" date if of proper type.
      Returns:
      true if the Dates are equal, false otherwise.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date date)
      Compare two dates.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      date - the classes.Date to be compared.
      Returns:
      1 if "this" ahead of parameter, -1 if "this" before parameter, 0 if equal.
